event.summary: 08/14/1993: A bomb exploded along the route of a planned march northwest of Belfast by Northern Ireland Protestants. No one was reportedly killed or injured.
event.target1: Parade route of Northern Ireland Protestants in Londonderry
event.addnotes: The parade celebrates the Protestant defense of Londonderry from the invading Roman Catholic King James in 1689. The bomb appeared timed to disrupt the march of 12,000 Apprentice Boys, a pro-British fraternal order loyal to the British crown. This was one of two related attacks committed by the IRA in Northern Ireland (cf. 199308140003)
event.scite1: “N Ireland – Bomb, 2nd Ld Cplte,” The Canadian Press, August 14, 1993.
event.scite2: “IRA admits planting bomb, injuring 9,” Herald Sun, August 16, 1993.
